sponsored by the Asian Development Bank and UNICEF assessed programmes 
in seven Asian countries ( 18, 19 ). An assessment of nutritional trends associated with nine 
programmes (20) was carried out as part of the Combating malnutrition: time to act study  (21), 
which included four in-depth country investigations. The review was extended to include estimates 
of resources (intensity, as resources/head per year), coverage, outcomes and other key factors,
